SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Trust: Keep Your Storefront Secure and Functional

Keep your storefront, Experience Cloud site, and org up to date with the latest measures to protect against unauthorized access. Ensure that your storefront continues to provide a smooth, engaging, and intuitive experience for buyers.

Comply with Security Alerts for Guest User Access
Ensure that your Experience Cloud site data is secure by default, yet continues to support the same storefront experience for unregistered users that you currently provide. Several security alerts disallow guest user access by default, which affects storefronts where guest users can browse, create carts, check out, and self-register. This release contains fixes that ensure that guest users can continue to self-register and create carts, and provides resources for you to work around other restrictions.
Automatically Set Sharing Settings for Storefront Data
Keep your new storefront data more secure by default, and get started with new storefronts more quickly. An improvement in Salesforce Spring ’20 allows managed packages to set external sharing settings for custom objects. As a result, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now automatically sets the organization-wide default (OWD) external access sharing settings for its custom objects during installation.
Maintain JavaScript Libraries That Affect the Storefront Buyer Experience
Have confidence that your buyers' browsing experience is smooth and safe across all pages and components on your storefront. This release updates several of the third-party JavaScript libraries that B2B Commerce for Visualforce references by default when rendering front-end behavior.
Provide More Reliable Keyboard Navigation for Guest Buyer Checkout
Deliver an uninterrupted checkout experience for a storefront guest buyer, regardless of whether they click the UI or use keyboard buttons to navigate the checkout flow. This release fixes an issue where pressing Enter (Windows) or Return (macOS) on the Process Payment button during checkout invalidated the cart and reset checkout.
